shared_text:
Yuma School District One Child Nutrition Department
September 4 at 8:42 AM Â·

Due to USDA regulation changes, Yuma School District One is now offering both Breakfast and Lunch FREE for all children 18 years old and younger. Children do not have to attend Yuma School District One. Parents can pick up meals for their child, they just need to fill out a form that verifies the meal is for a child.

Meals are served from 10:30am-12:30pm, Monday-Friday at the following school sites:
Castle Dome 2353 Otondo Dr
Alice Byrne 811 W 16th St
Carver School 1341 W. 5th Street
Dorothy Hall 5777 E 45th Pl
Rolle 2711 Engler Avenue
McGraw 2345 S. Arizona Avenue
Palmcroft 901 Palmcroft Drive
Fourth Ave Jr. High 450 W 5th Street
Roosevelt 450 W 5th Street
OC Johnson School 1201 W 12th St
Woodard 2250 S 8th Ave
Sunrise 9943 E 28th St
Desert Mesa 2350 Ave 7 1/2 E
Pecan Grove 600 S 21st Ave

Due to availability of products, there may be menu substitutions on the menu.

We will be closed on Monday, September 7th, 2020. LABOR DAY. Please email ethrower@yuma.org for questions and/or concerns. Or call the YSD One child nutrition office (928)502-4360.

City of Yuma Parks and Recreation
August 26 at 11:24 AM Â·

We All Count - Youth Art Competition

Description: Create a work of art under the theme of â€œWe All Countâ€ to help encourage all families in Yuma to complete the Census!

How it works:
1. Send an image of your childâ€™s submission to Arts@yumaaz.gov or exchange your artwork for a free ice cream at one of the City of Yuma Census Parades.
2. All images will be posted on the City of Yumaâ€™s Parks and
Recreation Facebook page for the community to view.
3. All images that have been received by September 16th will be in the running to win fun prizes, including a gift basket of art supplies!

Rules:
1. Participants must be in grades K-12.
2. Limit one work of art per child.
3. Make sure your household has filled out the Census!

Children and Family Resources about the Census
can be found here: https://www.census.gov/â€¦/2019/the-2020-census-challenge.html

We'd like to share the amazing improvement in numbers today, as Arizona Department of Health Services updated their Benchmark Dashboard. Thank you Yuma for making safe and healthy choices that moves us closer to reaching all 3 benchmarks.

This update also includes a slight change to MORLS (Monitored On-site Remote Learning Space). To address some confusion: schools are not reopening on Monday for in-person learning. If you would like to learn more about MORLS, please visit our website at https://www.yuma.org/Return-to-Learning

I am personally learning something new every day right alongside my Kids. I am constantly reminding myself about grace!
Also, if you have a question, just ask. Donâ€™t hesitate. There is a very strong chance that you are not alone. We are part of an awesome school and we should all support each other.

post_text:
Here is great information for OC Johnson families...

#ONEteam #ONEcommunity #YSDğŸ¥‡
shared_text:
O.C. Johnson Elementary School
July 29 at 10:58 AM Â·

Here is our Jaguar News for the month of August. Remember, your student's teacher will be reaching out to you tomorrow or Friday to set up an appointment for next week. During that appointment, you will sign iPad paperwork, get the iPad and any other learning materials and meet the teacher. We ask that ONLY ONE parent/guardian and the child (if you wish) attend that appointment. Masks must be worn by all!! Please do not bring any school supplies at that time. Those will be needed for those that return to in person learning when that occurs.
We understand that there are a lot of questions surrounding this year. We will continue to do our best to communicate what we know when we know it. Please continue to have patience as we are all navigating the unknown and doing the absolute best we can for our Jaguars and their families. We are committed to providing our students with a quality learning experience. As always, please reach out with any questions or concerns that you have. #jaguarstrong

PFC James D. Price Elementary School
July 10 at 5:22 PM Â·

Price families,

Thank you all for your feedback this week in regards to your return to learning decisions. Mrs. Corners made every effort to talk with each of you via phone or email. If you were not contacted, or know of a new family that needs to be contacted, please reach out to me personally via email (jnorris@yuma.org). Provide your name, child's name, and contact info. I will reach out to you next week. Your responses will help us prepare for our students to return safely when the time comes. Thank you all for your patience and understanding!

Thank you,

Jarrod Norris
Principal, James D. Price Elementary School
jnorris@yuma.org 928-502-7730

June 24 at 11:11 AM Â·

Emergency Rental Assistance Program for Yuma residents affected by the COVID-19.

The City of Yuma has an Emergency Rental Assistance Program for Yuma residents affected by the COVID-19.

If a person/family in this situation qualifies they could get help with up to three months of rent.

We know there are many city residents that have been impacted by the virus and are struggling to meet basic needs who could benefit from this program, please share among your family and friends.

Good afternoon Rolle families. Paper copies of the District Weekly update have been attached to the front gate if you would like to stop by and pick one up.

Friday the 26th June will be the last day for lunch at our Rolle site. Once we get more info on the sites that will remain open in the district we will share.

The district platform Clever will only work for online learning until June 30th. Please see attached info on other sites students can be working on to keep their brains growing. Khan Academy just sent out info on their Camp Khan to work on math skills to get ready for the next grade.
https://www.khanacademy.org/partner-content/camp-khan/x25450d2742bb665e:camp-khan-2020/x25450d2742bb665e:camp-khan-resources/a/camp-khan-program-overview

June 8 at 9:46 AM Â·

Yes, we are open for meals!

Beginning today 6/8/20, we will be serving breakfast and lunch out of Otondo Cafeteria, rather than next door at Castle Dome. We hope this is easier for parents to access meals.

Parents may pick up meals for their families once they have made their first initial visit with each school cafeteria.

Ask for details from the school cafeteria manager on site. Or email ethrower@yuma.org

UPDATE: We are very grateful to YPD and Ron Watsonâ€™s SRO for their swift action in identifying and arresting the suspects. As stated in an update by YPD, 3 juveniles have been arrested, and a 4th has been identified.
Also, a big thank you to staff, parents, and the Yuma community for your concern and offers of help. Your kindness is truly appreciated.

District One is heartbroken to report the following incident at Ron Watson Middle School. If you have any information, please contact the Yuma Police Department.

Saying goodbye to the 2019-2020 school year in style! Way to go YSD One Child Nutrition Department. Weâ€™ve served 715,500 meals since the school closures began on March 16th. Way to work together as a team! Time to close this adventurous chapter and move on to our next hurdle, the Summer Food Program.

post_text:
With District One classrooms being past recipients of both Fuel Your School and DonorsChoose, we are excited about this partnership!
#ONEteam #ONEcommunity #YSD1
shared_text:
Chevron Fuel Your School
May 28 at 7:51 AM Â·

With many parents working from home and students learning from home, the needs of teachers and students have dramatically changed. Because of that, Chevron is exploring a new collaboration with DonorsChoose on innovative efforts to help address the changing needs of teachers and their students in the Fuel Your School Program communities impacted most by COVID-19. This collaboration will take the place of Fuel Your School, which is being temporarily paused. Fuel Your School typically runs in October, with Chevron donating $1 per eight or more-gallon purchase at participating Chevron and Texaco stations, up to a certain amount in each area. Chevronâ€™s donations are used to help fund classroom projects posted on DonorsChoose.org by teachers in various area.

Message from Mrs. Peach:

â€œOn Wednesday, May 27th we will have large manila envelopes ready for each of our students. These envelopes will contain their report card, certificates they have been awarded, graded work they may have turned in, class pictures that were purchased, and other items from their teacher. We also have personal belongings bagged up and ready to send home. Please ask your child if they still need these items. All of our Fifth graders will be receiving a free yearbook that is signed by their teacher and myself. Yearbooks for other students will be sold at the beginning of next year. Please come to school and pick up your childâ€™s envelope between 8:00 AM and 4:00 PM on May 27th. post_text:
Each year, Yuma School District One plans a special night to celebrate employees who have reached a milestone year with the district: years 10, 15, 20, 25, 30, and more.

While we are not able to celebrate in the traditional way this year, District One invites you to join us in a virtual celebration.

Thank you for your dedication to helping students reach their goals and for dedicating your time to District One. We are ONE community, pursing excellence!

#ONEteam #ONEcommunity #YSD1

shared_text:
Ron Watson Middle School
May 19 at 2:35 PM Â·

Virtual Summer School Opportunity!

When: Starting the week of June 8th & ending on June 26th

Who: Any current RWMS 6th-8th grader

Times: Depends on the class & Teacher

What Classes:
Ms. Garcia - Wacky Debates
Ms. Hall - Current Events/Social-Emotional Support
Mr. Jones - Book Club

*you will need to have access to Internet, you may use your own device (phone, electronic device, computer) or you may check out your iPad to use

*email the teacher of the class you are interested in
Ms. Garcia fgarcia10@yuma.org
Ms. Hall - chall@yuma.org
Mr. Jones - mjones2@yuma.org

Other inquiries about Summer School please email Ms. Garcia at fgarcia10@yuma.org

post_text: Mrs. Hazen says, "Do you know the "Soap that Floats" was invented by accident? Does it really float? Do other bars of soap float? Have you ever put this soap in the microwave to see what happens when it is heated? Do other soaps react the same way? Well, I am so excited that Room B students are still curious, and are #StillLearning, even though we are not together in our classroom at Alice Byrne! Be curious! Stay motivated! Keep learning!!" #ONEteam #ONEcommunity #YSD1 #ONEgoal
text: Mrs. Hazen says, "Do you know the "Soap that Floats" was invented by accident? Does it really float? Do other bars of soap float? Mercedes is truly special to the Woodard community and have inspired so many.
#ONEteam #ONEcommunity #YSD1
shared_text:
Woodard Junior High School
May 5 at 8:08 PM Â·

A little over 2 years ago our Woodard Family welcomed an incredibly bright, shining, loving spirit to our campus and our lives were blessed the day we met Mercedes. Yesterday we took a moment to remind Mercedes that Once Youâ€™re A Roadrunner....Youâ€™re ALWAYS A Roadrunner.

https://www.facebook.com/ValEska999/videos/10163369406785534/

A heartfelt Thank You to Mrs. Nash for organizing the special event. Also, a big Thank You to all the Woodard Staff and friends of Mercedes who joined us. Lastly, a huge Thank You to our friends at Yuma Police Department, City of Yuma Fire Department, and Rural Metro Fire - Yuma County for joining us and making this such a lasting memory.

#RoadrunnerPride
#OneARoadrunnerAlwaysARoadrunner

shared_text:
George Washington Carver Elementary School
May 5 at 11:58 AM Â·

BE A COBRA! Our registration for kindergarteners, new students, and open enrollment are available and in front of our office door!
Completed registration packets and copies of your child's birth certificate, shot records, and proof of address can be dropped off Monday to Thursday from 9am to 3pm. Just leave it in the box just outside our office door.
Call our office at 502-7600 with any questions.
And help us spread the word, hit "LIKE" and "SHARE" to get the word out! Thanks!

post_text:
OC Johnson encourages STEM in and out of the classroom. Opportunities to learn are all around us. Great job Jaguars!
#ONEteam #ONEcommunity #YSD1 #ONEgoal
shared_text:
O.C. Johnson Elementary School
April 25 at 7:36 PM Â·

Our weekly challenge: Who could build the biggest tower out of household items? Several of our Jaguars used their creativity and their STEAM skills to build some pretty amazing towers. Darey and Cerline built towers even taller than Mrs. Logan....Wow!! Mrs. Little's family and Abigahil had the same idea and used their pillows. Those look like comfy towers. It looks like Max had the tallest tower...even taller than a house.... You all rock!! All of our participants will receive prizes. Look for those in the mail very soon. I can't wait to see what next week's challenge will be!!

Pecan Grove Elementary School
April 21 at 4:31 PM Â·

Hello Pecan Grove Families,

In order to make Carver Elementary's lunch pick up on Thursday safer and run more efficiently, we are requiring that you only enter the Carver Elementary parking lot by turning right from 5th street. After you pick up your lunches, you can only exit by turning right out of the parking lot. We appreciate your cooperation.

Pecan Grove Elementary School
April 21 at 4:31 PM Â·

Hello Pecan Grove Families,

In order to make Carver Elementary's lunch pick up on Thursday safer and run more efficiently, we are requiring that you only enter the Carver Elementary parking lot by turning right from 5th street. After you pick up your lunches, you can only exit by turning right out of the parking lot. We appreciate your cooperation.

shared_text:
FAMILY.TITANK12.COM
Titan School Solutions

Yuma School District One Child Nutrition Department
April 21 at 12:28 PM Â·

Yuma School District One families are encouraged to apply for free or reduced-price meals for the CURRENT 2019-2020 school year.

Why now?

In addition to having free/reduced-price meal benefits that would carry over for the first 30 days of the new school year, families may qualify for additional benefits now through the Families First Coronavirus Response Act and would help our district qualify for other grant funding.

If you are new to the district or have recently had a change in financial circumstances, please apply online at the Titan Family Portal (link below). All information is completely confidential. There is no limit to how many times you can apply during the school year.

Note: All families must apply for free/reduced-price meals on an annual basis.

https://family.titank12.com/

A big congratulations to Zulema, Fourth Avenue Junior High School 7th grader, the winner of the 2019-2020 Young American Award from the Yuma County chapter of the Military Officers Association of America. She received a cash prize and the number one spot in a field of strong competition. As the winner, Zulema will later be able to apply for their senior award and up to $1,500 towards her academic goals!

Rolle shared some information that may be helpful for parents at any school. Thanks Rolle!
#ONEteam #ONEcommunity #YSD1 #ONEgoal
shared_text:
PLUS.SMILEBOX.COM
Something went wrong

James B. Rolle School
April 9 at 9:54 AM Â·

Reminder: ipad, shirts and medication pick up today 11-1. Right lane for pick up, left lane for lunch. Bring Paper with student names, teacher and what you are picking up to display in your car window.

If you have been struggling with the ipads you already have picked up please give them another go. There were more glitches to start off with and they seem to have settled down.

Some tips:
*Logging on in the morning and download assignments to PDF Cabinet. (See this slideshow for more assistance). Mornings seem to be less glitchy.
No internet needed for PDF Cabinet while working on assignments.
*Work on assignments during the day and then attach a screenshot of the assignment back in Google Classroom to turn in the assignment. Please reach out to teachers or myself for any questions.

PDF Cabinet slideshow: http://plus.smilebox.com/play?g=159f914a-500a-4cfa-940c-17fc21601005&sbid=3464

shared_text:
Yuma School District One Child Nutrition Department
March 31 at 9:44 PM Â·

Just wanted the Yuma community know that we are still serving meals during the AZ Stay at Home Executive Order. Meals are M-F, 11:00am-1:00pm.

However, this week we do have a few schools on our YSD One scheduled Spring Break. The schools that are OPEN this week are as follows: Palmcroft, Alice Byrne, Woodard Jr High, OC Johnson, Carver, Gila Vista Jr. High, McGraw, Rolle, Desert Mesa and Castle Dome.

The schools that are CLOSED are as follows: Pecan Grove, Roosevelt, 4th Ave Jr. High, Sunrise, Dorothy Hall, Ron Watson and Otondo.

shared_text:
Yuma School District One Child Nutrition Department
March 27 at 9:22 PM Â·

Keep up the good work YSD ONE School Nutrition Heroes! We appreciate the love this week from our Yuma community. Our staff received so much positive feedback from students and parents. Our school nutrition heroes served a total of 62,820 meals this week.

Over this 2 week period of school closures our staff has served over 100,000 meals. The days have been long, but the smiles have been worth it!

See you all on Monday! 11:00-1:00pm Make sure to take note of the schools that are closed over our scheduled Spring Break next week. Pecan Grove, Otondo, Roosevelt, 4th Ave, Dorothy Hall, Sunrise and Ron Watson.

post_text:
Some helpful tips when heading to our schools for grab 'n go meals.
#ONEteam #ONEcommunity #YSD1 #ONEgoal
shared_text:
Yuma School District One Child Nutrition Department
March 26 at 9:01 PM Â·

To help us keep the Drive-Thru line moving along during meal service, please help with the following:

Be ready to tell us how many kids you have in the car ğŸ– (This is a USDA & ADE regulation, not a school rule).

Please open the trunk of your car or the hatch to limit contact with employees. (If possible).

Please do your best to stay 6 feet apart from employees.

Make sure meals for the next day get properly stored in the refrigerator until it is time to eat them.

Be kind to the school nutrition employees. They really do love and miss your kids!â¤ï¸

shared_text:
Yuma School District One Child Nutrition Department
March 25 at 9:02 AM Â·

Thank you again for supporting our YSD One Child Nutrition Staff during this difficult time. I know many parents are getting upset that our department is enforcing the rule from USDA and Arizona Department of Education stating the child must be in the car to receive a meal. Please do not take your frustrations out on our cafeteria staff. Unfortunately, we have many adults that are requesting 10 meals at a time with no children in their cars. If we were to do this for every person that requested it, we would run out of food, similar to what is currently happening in the grocery stores.

Our department understands times are tough and we want to help out whenever possible. However, there are still rules and regulations our department must follow in order to be in compliance. Thank you in advance for understandingâ¤ï¸

Yuma School District One Child Nutrition Department
March 23 at 9:12 AM Â·

Happy Monday! We want you to know that Yuma School District One is doing our best to provide meals for any child 18 years old and younger. We are at max capacity as far as how many meals we can prepare during this time. Our child nutrition staff are making more meals than we do on a normal school day.

We want our community to know that Crane School District and Yuma Union High School District are also serving meals. Here is a list of those schools and their hours of operation:

Crane District: Monday-Friday
10:30-2:00pm
Salida/Rancho-1020 S Avenue C,
Pueblo-2803 W 20th St,
Gary Knox-2926 S 21st Dr
Valley Horizon-4501 W 20th St,
Ronald Reagan-3200 W 16th St
HLS/Gowan-1590 S Avenue C
Mesquite-4250 W 16th St

Yuma Union High School District: Monday-Friday
11 am-1:00pm (grab and go curb side served in front of the schools)
Cibola HS-4100 W 20th St,
Gila Ridge-7150 E. 24th Street
Kofa HS-3100 South Avenue A.
San Luis HS-1250 8th Ave, San Luis, AZ
Yuma HS-400 S 6th Ave,

shared_text:
Kate Hazen
March 22 at 8:40 PM Â·

Remote learning is not ideal, but my students and parents are taking on this challenge and making the best of it! Look at the learning that is happening outside of the classroom, along with their digital assignments: engaging in art projects with grandparents, building a really cool fort to read in; watching our chrysalises turn into butterflies; visiting a farm to observe different animals; planting corn seeds from the U of A; playing games with family; constructing buildings, completing advanced challenging activities online, and sharing reflections on student learning! Teaching remotely is so challenging, yet, seeing these photos shared with me, is so rewarding!! Yuma School District One Alice Byrne PTO Yuma Area Ag

shared_text:
Yuma School District One Child Nutrition Department
March 20 at 10:28 PM Â·

We made it to the weekend! Today we served 11,610 meals for children in the Yuma Community. That is the same amount of meals that we serve on any given day in our school district. Our schools have been closed for 5 days and our department has served 40,060 meals this week. It has been a long week and our school nutrition staff deserve the weekend to rest!

We will back at it on Monday, March 23rd. 11:00am-1:00pm. Our staff is working extra hard to make sure we donâ€™t run out of your favorite school meals. Please be kind to all employees that are working. A smile goes a long way!

Here is a list of our schools in Yuma School District Oneâ˜€ï¸

https://www.yuma.org/Our_Schools

shared_text:
Gila Vista Jr. High School
March 20 at 12:11 PM Â·

ATTENTION ALL STUDENTS and PARENTS

Please be aware that Google Classroom is at times having issues with opening attachments to assignments (File not Found) and with the ability to turn things in. All of your teachers are aware of this and the school district's technology department is aware and they are trying to find a fix. Unfortunately, it is possibly out of our control and will just be something we have to be patient with.

A number for you have reported the issues in the late afternoon and evening, between the hours of 4:30 pm and 11 pm. Those same students have been able to turn things in the next morning before noon.

So, our suggestion is to work in the morning or work in an of line format and turn things in later. Your teachers will not mark things late that are turned in within a day or so.

Thanks for your patience and understand as we all adjust to this way of doing things

shared_text:
Yuma School District One Child Nutrition Department
March 19 at 7:26 PM Â·

Here is a video taken today by our school cafeteria manager at McGraw Elementary School. She has given me permission to share on our page. I think it is evident these meals are made with love. Today was homemade Pigs in the Blanket! One of my all time favorite school meals.

â€œAs we completed day four of our Grab-n-Go program I wondered how many people really understand what goes into what weâ€™re doing. So hereâ€™s a short little video of us prepping 800 meals. My school has gone from feeding 135 kids on Monday to 426 kids today. Any child in the community is given a lunch for the day and breakfast for the next morning. Today our district expects to feed over 10,000 children. Just so blessed to be a part of this and all the parents are so grateful, confirming that what weâ€™re doing is so needed right now in the community.ï¿¼ï¿¼â€

By the way, they ended up serving nearly 875 meals on-site today. Thank you Lorri and team for all that you doâ¤ï¸

March 19 at 7:26 PM Â·

Here is a video taken today by our school cafeteria manager at McGraw Elementary School. She has given me permission to share on our page. I think it is evident these meals are made with love. Today was homemade Pigs in the Blanket! One of my all time favorite school meals.

â€œAs we completed day four of our Grab-n-Go program I wondered how many people really understand what goes into what weâ€™re doing. So hereâ€™s a short little video of us prepping 800 meals. My school has gone from feeding 135 kids on Monday to 426 kids today. Any child in the community is given a lunch for the day and breakfast for the next morning. Today our district expects to feed over 10,000 children. Just so blessed to be a part of this and all the parents are so grateful, confirming that what weâ€™re doing is so needed right now in the community.ï¿¼ï¿¼â€

By the way, they ended up serving nearly 875 meals on-site today. Thank you Lorri and team for all that you doâ¤ï¸

shared_text:
YOUTUBE.COM
Parents Guide to Google Classroom in 2020

James B. Rolle School
March 18 at 9:18 AM Â·

Parents and students. Google is getting a lot of traffic and that might be why things are not saving/shutting down. If they are having issues, then they could do the assignment on paper or a notebook. Then they could take a picture and upload the picture. We are hoping this may be resolved down the road. Here is a video about Google Classroom. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2Iowi-gmbys

Also parents please talk to your student about writing content that is not appropriate. This can be seen by teachers, coaches and myself. This will not be tolerated. I will also put a comment in Google Classroom for students to see.

shared_text:
Yuma Family YMCA
March 16 at 9:53 AM Â·

The YMCA is stepping in and offering emergency full day child care services for kids 5-12 years old.
Childcare will be at the Main Yuma Branch and at the Somerton Youth Center.
Main Branch:
Starts 3/17
Hours: 6:30am-6:00pm
Price: $150/wk for members & $205/wk for nonmembers F/A is available for families.
Meals: Breakfast & Lunch provided
Capacity: 150 kids

Somerton Youth Center:
Starts 3/16 at noon Today
Hours: 7:30am-5:30pm
Price: $45/wk for all students. F/A is not offered for this discounted price
Meals: Breakfast & Lunch provided
Capacity: 100 kids
Registration forms available at both locations.
Email annieclary@vosymca.org, call 928-317-0522 or stop by the YMCA for more information.
